intro: Epilobium virgatum f. friesanum, commonly known as the Friesian willow herb, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pinkish to white flowers in terminal clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands, stream banks, and woodland edges. This plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits, supporting various pollinators.
